A.tip: A can say /ă/ (short) as in apple, /ā/ (long) as in ape, or /ä/ as in father.

B.tip: B says /b/ as in ball. It's a voiced sound.

C.tip: C says /k/ before a, o, u (cat) and /s/ before e, i, y (cent, city).

D.tip: D says /d/ as in dog. It's a voiced sound.

E.tip: E can say /ĕ/ (short) as in egg or /ē/ (long) as in eagle.

F.tip: F says /f/ as in fish. It's an unvoiced sound.

G.tip: G says /g/ before a, o, u (goat) and /j/ before e, i, y (gem, gym).

H.tip: H says /h/ as in hat. It's a breathy sound.

I.tip: I can say /ĭ/ (short) as in igloo or /ī/ (long) as in ice.

J.tip: J says /j/ as in jam. It's a voiced sound.

K.tip: K says /k/ as in kite. It's an unvoiced sound.

L.tip: L says /l/ as in lion. Place your tongue behind your teeth.

M.tip: M says /m/ as in moon. Your lips come together.

N.tip: N says /n/ as in nest. Your tongue touches the roof of your mouth.

O.tip: O can say /ŏ/ (short) as in octopus, /ō/ (long) as in open, or /ö/ as in move.

P.tip: P says /p/ as in pig. It's an unvoiced sound with a puff of air.

Q.tip: Q always comes with U and says /kw/ as in queen.

R.tip: R says /r/ as in rabbit. Curl your tongue back slightly.

S.tip: S says /s/ at the start (sun) and /z/ at the end of words (rose, has).

T.tip: T says /t/ as in tiger. It's an unvoiced sound.

U.tip: U can say /ŭ/ (short) as in umbrella, /ū/ (long) as in unicorn, or /oo/ as in put.

V.tip: V says /v/ as in van. It's a voiced sound. Bite your lower lip.

W.tip: W says /w/ as in water. Round your lips like you're saying 'oo'.

X.tip: X says /ks/ at the end (box) and /z/ at the start (xylophone, x-ray).

Y.tip: Y says /y/ at the start (yellow), /ī/ in the middle (my), or /ē/ at the end (happy).

Z.tip: Z says /z/ as in zebra. It's a voiced sound like a buzzing bee.
